unit.name: Beast Lord
unit.description: single model, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Pack Tactics, Strider (Forest), Light Armour, Primal Instinct

unit.name: Beast Chieftain
unit.description: single model, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Pack Tactics, Strider (Forest), Light Armour, Primal Instinct

unit.name: Soothsayer
unit.description: single model, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Blood Offering, Pack Tactics, Strider (Forest), Primal Instinct

unit.name: Centaur Chieftain
unit.description: single model, Height Standard, Type Cavalry, Base 25x50 mm, Drunkard, Looted Booze, Strider (Forest), Light Armour, Primal Instinct

unit.name: Minotaur Warlord
unit.description: single model, Height Large, Type Infantry, Base 40x40 mm, Fearless, Frenzy, Strider (Forest), Light Armour, Battle Focus, Impact Hits (D3), Primal Instinct

unit.name: Minotaur Chieftain
unit.description: single model, Height Large, Type Infantry, Base 40x40 mm, Fearless, Frenzy, Strider (Forest), Light Armour, Battle Focus, Impact Hits (D3), Primal Instinct

unit.name: Wildhorn Herd
unit.description: 15-50 models, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Pack Tactics, Scoring, Strider (Forest), Primal Instinct

unit.name: Mongrel Herd
unit.description: 20-50 models, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 20x20 mm, Pack Tactics, Scoring, Strider (Forest), Shield, Primal Instinct

unit.name: Mongrel Raiders
unit.description: 10-20 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 20x20 mm, Light Troops, Pack Tactics, Skirmisher, Strider (Forest), Hard Target (1), Primal Instinct, Bow (4+)

unit.name: Feral Hounds (core)
unit.description: 8-20 models, 0-5 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Beast, Base 25x50 mm, Ambush, Insignificant, Strider (Forest), Vanguard

unit.name: Raiding Chariots (core)
unit.description: 3 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Light Troops, Strider (Forest), Swiftstride, Light Armour, Wildhorn Crew: Primal Instinct, Light Lance, Longhorn Crew: Primal Instinct, Great Weapon, War Hog (2): Harnessed, Chassis: Impact Hits (D6), Inanimate

unit.name: Feral Hounds
unit.description: 5-7 models, 0-5 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Beast, Base 25x50 mm, Ambush, Insignificant, Strider (Forest), Vanguard

unit.name: Longhorn Herd
unit.description: 10-40 models, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 25x25 mm, Bodyguard (Beast Lord, Beast Chieftain), Pack Tactics, Scoring, Strider (Forest), Heavy Armour, Primal Instinct

unit.name: Minotaurs
unit.description: 3-10 models, 0-5 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Infantry, Base 40x40 mm, Fearless, Frenzy, Scoring, Strider (Forest), Light Armour, Battle Focus, Impact Hits (1), Primal Instinct

unit.name: Centaurs
unit.description: 5-15 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Cavalry, Base 25x50 mm, Drunkard, Scoring, Strider (Forest), Light Armour, Shield, Primal Instinct

unit.name: Raiding Chariots
unit.description: 1-2 models, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Light Troops, Strider (Forest), Swiftstride, Light Armour, Wildhorn Crew: Primal Instinct, Light Lance, Longhorn Crew: Primal Instinct, Great Weapon, War Hog (2): Harnessed, Chassis: Impact Hits (D6), Inanimate

unit.name: Razortusk Herd
unit.description: 1-10 models, 0-3 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Beast, Base 50x50 mm, Strider (Forest), Devastating Charge (+1 Str, +1 AP)

unit.name: Razortusk Chariot
unit.description: single model, 0-4 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Hunting Horn, Light Troops, Strider (Forest), Swiftstride, Heavy Armour Wildhorn Crew: Primal Instinct, Light Lance, Longhorn Crew: Primal Instinct, Great Weapon, Razortusk: Devastating Charge (+1 Str, +1 AP), Harnessed, Chassis: Impact Hits (D6+1), Inanimate

unit.name: Briar Beast
unit.description: single model, 0-3 Units/Army, Height Large, Type Beast, Base 40x40 mm, Fear, Fearless, Random Movement (3D6"), Sleeper, Strider (Forest), Unbreakable

unit.name: Gargoyles
unit.description: 5-10 models, 0-3 Units/Army, Height Standard, Type Infantry, Base 20x20 mm, Fly (9", 18"), Light Troops, Skirmisher, Strider (Forest), Swiftstride, Hard Target (1), Devastating Charge (+1 Str, +1 AP), Primal Instinct

unit.name: Cyclops
unit.description: single model, 0-3 Units/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Infantry, Base 50x100 mm, Fearless, Magic Resistance (3), Strider (Forest), Aegis (5+), Divine Attacks, Hurl Attack (4+)

unit.name: Gortach
unit.description: single model, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Infantry, Base 50x100 mm, Fearless, Frenzy, Strider (Forest), Stubborn, Battle Focus, Impact Hits (D3), Lethal Strike, Primal Instinct, Strength from Flesh

unit.name: Jabberwock
unit.description: single model, 0-2 Units/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Beast, Base 50x100 mm, Aura of Madness, Fearless, Fly (8", 16"), Light Troops, Strider (Forest), Breath Attack (Str 3, AP 2), Poison Attacks

unit.name: Beast Giant
unit.description: single model, 0-3 Units/Army, Height Gigantic, Type Infantry, Base 50x75 mm, Giant See Giant Do, Rage

mount.name: Raiding Chariot
mount.description: Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Light Troops, Strider (Forest), Swiftstride, Wildhorn Crew: Primal Instinct, Light Lance, War Hog (2): Harnessed, Chassis: Impact Hits (D6), Inanimate

mount.name: Razortusk Chariot
mount.description: Height Large, Type Construct, Base 50x100 mm, Hunting Horn, Light Troops, Strider (Forest), Swiftstride, Wildhorn Crew: Primal Instinct, Light Lance, Razortusk: Devastating Charge (+1 Str, +1 AP), Harnessed, Chassis: Impact Hits (D6+1), Inanimate

item.name: Drunkard
item.description: The unit may gain one of two different sets of effects depending on whether it shows up Sober or Drunk on the Battlefield. At step 8 of the Pre-Game Sequence (after Spell Selection), the player must choose whether a Drunkard unit is Sober or Drunk. Drunk Characters cannot join units containing any Sober models and vice versa (models without Drunkard are considered neither Drunk nor Sober).

item.name: Sober
item.description: The model gains Light Troops and Vanguard. A unit that has been Sober once loses Scoring for the rest of the game. If playing Capture the Flags, Scoring is not lost.

item.name: Drunk
item.description: The model gains Devastating Charge (+1 Str, +1 AP) and Fearless. Drunk units cannot Ambush.

item.name: Hunting Call
item.description: If the army includes a model with Hunting Call, the owner may: - Choose to roll for Ambush for units with one or more models with Pack Tactics starting from the owners Player Turn 1 (but still at the end of step 2 of the Movement Phase Sequence), unless the owner has the first Player Turn. - Reroll Ambush rolls of 1-2 for units with one or more models with Pack Tactics. Hunting Call is in effect even if the bearer is Ambushing and has not arrived on the Battlefield yet.

item.name: Looted Booze
item.description: One use only. May be activated at the start of any Player Turn. All models with Drunkard in the bearers unit change from Sober to Drunk.

item.name: Pack Tactics
item.description: Units fully composed of models with Pack Tactics gain Swiftstride for the Charge Range roll if they are Located in the Charged units Flank or Rear Facing when rolling their Charge Range in the Charge Phase.

item.name: Primal Instinct
item.description: Close Combat. At the start of each Round of Combat, each unit with one or more model parts with this Attack Attribute must take a Discipline Test. If the test is passed, all model parts with Primal Instinct in the unit must reroll failed to-hit rolls during this Round of Combat.

item.name: Beast Axe
item.description: Close Combat Weapon. Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Strength, +1 Armour Penetration, and always strike at Initiative Step 0. The wielder gains +2 Defensive Skill unless wielding another weapon. This weapon cannot be enchanted with Weapon Enchantments from the List of Common Special Items.

item.name: Black Wing Totem
item.description: A unit with all models affected by the spell gains +3 Agility and adds D3+1" to its Charge Range.

item.name: Blooded Horn Totem
item.description: The target gains +1 Attack Value, and its Close Combat Attacks gain +2 Armour Penetration.

item.name: Clouded Eye Totem
item.description: A unit with all models affected by the spell gains Hard Target (1) and Magic Resistance (3).

item.name: Gnarled Hide Totem
item.description: The target gains +1 Armour and Distracting.

item.name: Totem Bearer
item.description: Totems borne by Champions contain a single Bound Spell chosen from the list above, which must be noted on the Army List, and have the Type: Casters Unit.

item.name: Greater Totem Bearer
item.description: Greater Totems borne by Characters contain all four Bound Spells from the list above and have the Types: Augment and Range 18".

item.name: Hawthorne Curse
item.description: Models without Ambush only. Enchantment: Hand Weapon. Attacks made with this weapon gain Devastating Charge (+2 Str, +2 AP) and become Magical Attacks. The weapon can be used as a Shooting Weapon (3+) with the following profile: Range 18", Shots 1, Str 3 [6], AP 10, Area Attack (1x5), Reload!, [Multiple Wounds (D3)]. This Shooting Attack never suffers negative to-hit modifiers.

item.name: Ancestral Carvings
item.description: 0-3 per Army. Soothsayers only. Enchantment: Hand Weapon. Attacks made with this weapon gain +2 Strength and +2 Armour Penetration, and become Magical Attacks. The wielder gains +2 Attack Value and Distracting while using this weapon.

item.name: Fatal Folly
item.description: Enchantment: Beast Axe. Attacks made with this weapon become Magical Attacks. For each Close Combat Attack against the wielders model that rolls a natural to-hit roll of 1, the wielder must perform a Close Combat Attack at the same Initiative Step (this overrides the normal restriction that Beast Axe attacks always strike at Initiative Step 0). This must be allocated towards the model (or Health Pool) that rolled the 1 to hit.

item.name: Twin Hungers
item.description: Enchantment: Paired Weapons. Attacks made with this weapon gain Lethal Strike and become Magical Attacks. Whenever the wielder rolls a natural 6 to wound with a Close Combat Attack, and this attack causes an unsaved wound, the bearer Recovers 1 Health Point at the end of the Initiative Step. No more than 1 Health Point may be recovered per phase in this manner.

item.name: Aaghors Affliction
item.description: Enchantment: Light Armour. The wearer gains +1 Resilience and Fortitude (4+), but automatically fails all of its Armour Saves.

item.name: Tricksters Cunning
item.description: Enchantment: Light Armour. Successful to-wound rolls against the wearers model must be rerolled.

item.name: Wild Form
item.description: Enchantment: Suit of Armour. At the start of the Melee Phase, the bearer may choose to gain either of the following: - +1 Strength, +1 Armour Penetration, and -1 Resilience - -1 Strength, -1 Armour Penetration, and +1 Resilience The effects last until the end of the Melee Phase.

item.name: Obscuring Fog
item.description: Enchantment: Shield. While using this Shield, enemy units in base contact with the bearer suffer -1 Agility. The bearers unit does not benefit from +1 Agility from Charging Momentum.

item.name: Banner of the Wild Herd
item.description: 0-3 per Army. One use only. A single Banner of the Wild Herd per unit may be activated at the start of each Round of Combat. For the duration of this Round of Combat, all Mongrels and Wildhorns in the bearers unit gain +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration.

item.name: Dark Rain
item.description: One use only. This Artefact is automatically activated at the start of the first Game Turn (if the bearer is not on the Battlefield at this time, the item cannot be used). Its effects last until the end of the Game Turn. If the owner has the second Player Turn, all Shooting Attacks suffer -2 to hit during the opponents Shooting Phase. If the owner has the first Player Turn, instead all Shooting Attacks suffer -1 to hit during the opponents Shooting Phase.

item.name: Seed of the Dark Forest
item.description: One use only. Right before the battle (during step 7 of the Deployment Phase Sequence), the bearer must place a single Forest Terrain Feature that must be no larger than 10" in length and 6" in width on the Battlefield, not in contact with any other Terrain Feature except Open Terrain, more than 1" away from all enemy units, and with its centre within 12" of the bearer. All friendly models inside this Forest Terrain Feature gain a +1 modifier to their casting rolls for Augment, Hex, and Universal spells, and add (+1/+1) to the Power Level of Totem Bound Spells they cast.

item.name: Pillager Icon
item.description: All friendly units within 12" of the bearer comprised entirely of Razortusks or single model Chariots, excluding Characters, gain Vanguard.

item.name: Eye of Dominance
item.description: Close Combat Attacks from Beast, Cavalry, and Construct models will always hit the bearer only on a roll of 6+. If the attacking model is a multipart model, only model parts with Harnessed are affected.

item.name: Inscribing Burin
item.description: While the bearer has the centre of its base inside a Forest Terrain Feature, all friendly units with more than half of their models with the centre of their bases inside any Forest Terrain Feature on the Battlefield gain Magic Resistance (2).

item.name: Crown of Horns
item.description: The bearers unit and all units within range of its Commanding Presence (if applicable) automatically pass Discipline Tests taken due to Primal Instinct.

item.name: Hunting Horn
item.description: Universal Rule. All friendly units within 6" of one or more models with Hunting Horn gain +1" to their Charge Range rolls.

item.name: Blood Offering
item.description: Universal Rule. A unit that includes at least one Character with Blood Offering may reroll failed Panic Tests at the cost of inflicting one wound with no saves of any kind allowed to a Character with Blood Offering in the unit.

item.name: Paired Weapons and Throwing Weapons (5+)
item.description: - Paired Weapons: Two-Handed . The wielder gains +1 Attack Value and +1 Offensive Skill when using Paired Weapons. Attacks made with Paired Weapons ignore Parry (while Paired Weapons are often modelled as two Hand - Throwing Weapons (5+): Range 8", Shots 2, Strength as user, AP as user, Accurate, Quick to Fire

item.name: Ambush and Scout
item.description: - Ambush: Units with Ambush may be deployed using Special Deployment rules. All units that will be deployed using the Ambush rule must be declared at step 8 of the Pre-Game Sequence (after Spell Selection), starting with the player that chose their Deployment Zone. Deploy your army as usual, but without the Ambushing units. Starting with your Player Turn 2, immediately after step 2 of the Movement Phase Sequence (after moving units with Random Movement ), roll a dice for each of your Ambushing units. After rolling for all Ambushing units, all units that rolled 3+ enter the Battlefield from any Board Edge. Place the arriving units with their Rear Facing in contact and aligned with the Board Edge. Ambushers are subject to the following rules and restrictions: - Ambushing models can neither March Move during the Movement Phase in which they arrive, nor can they voluntarily end that Movement Phase farther away from the Board Edge that they arrived from than their March Rate. - Ambushing models count as having moved during the turn they arrive on the Battlefield. - If an Ambushing unit has not entered the Battlefield before the end of the game (e.g. due to failing all its 3+ rolls), the unit counts as destroyed. - An Ambushing unit that enters the Battlefield on Game Turn 4 or later loses Scoring . - An Ambushing Character may Ambush within an Ambushing unit that it is allowed to join (declare this when declaring which units are Ambushing). Roll only one dice for the Combined Unit. - Until arriving on the Battlefield, Ambushing units cannot perform any actions at all, and all their Special Items, rules, and abilities dont work while off the board. - Scout: Units with Scout may be deployed using Special Deployment rules. All units that will be deployed using the Scout rule must be declared at step 8 of the Pre-Game Sequence (after Spell Selection), starting with the player that chose their Deployment Zone. Scout deployment is conducted on Step 5 of the Deployment Phase (Deploy Scouting Units). If both players have Scouting units, alternate unit placement (one unit at a time), starting with the player who first completed their normal deployment. Scouting units have three deployment options: - Fully inside your Deployment Zone, using the normal deployment rules - Anywhere on the Battlefield at least 18" away from enemy units - Anywhere on the Battlefield fully inside a Field, Forest, Ruins, or Water Terrain Feature and at least 12" away from enemy units Scouting units that arent placed fully inside their Deployment Zone may not declare Charges in the first Player Turn of the first Game Turn (there are no Scout Charge restrictions after the first Player Turn).

item.name: Sleeper
item.description: Universal Rule. The model follows the rules for Ambush with the following exceptions: - Immediatly after step 2 of the owners Movement Phase Sequence (including the owners Player Turn 1), the owner may decide for each of their Briar Beasts if they will enter the Battlefield or not (no dice rolls are required). - When the model enters the Battlefield, it must be placed completely within any Forest Terrain Feature instead of having its Rear Facing touch the Board Edge. If the model cannot be placed, it cannot enter the Battlefield this turn.

item.name: Hurl Attack
item.description: Artillery Weapon. Catapult (4x4). Range 6-36", Shots 1, Str 3 [7], AP 0 [4], Divine Attacks, Magical Attacks, [Multiple Wounds (D3, Clipped Wings)]. A Cyclops that only Pivots (and moves no further) during its owners Movement Phase ignores the to-hit modifier from Moving and Shooting in the next Shooting Phase.

item.name: Strength from Flesh
item.description: Attack Attribute - Close Combat. Whenever a Gortach inflicts an unsaved wound with Lethal Strike (rolling a natural 6 to wound with a Close Combat Attack with Lethal Strike), the attack gains Multiple Wounds (D3), and the Gortach Recovers 1 Health Point at the end of the Initiative Step (unless the Gortach was removed as a casualty in this Initiative Step). No more than 1 Health Point may be Recovered by each Gortach per phase in this manner.

item.name: Aura of Madness
item.description: Universal Rule. Enemy units within 6" of one or more models with Aura of Madness suffer 1 Discipline.

item.name: Giant See Giant Do
item.description: Universal Rule. The model gains Drunkard and Strider (Forest). At the end of a friendly Movement Phase, if the model is in contact with a Forest Terrain Feature it may lose its current weapon (if applicable) and gain Uprooted Tree.

item.name: Rage
item.description: Attack Attribute - Close Combat. Whenever the model loses a Health Point, it gains +1 Attack Value. Whenever it gains a Health Point, it suffers 1 Attack Value.

item.name: Beer Barrel
item.description: Shooting Weapon. The bearer gains Looted Booze. Once per game, the weapon may be used as a Shooting Weapon with the following profile: Range 8", Shots 1, Str 4, AP 0, Area Attack (3x3), Reload!, hits automatically. After being used as a Shooting Weapon, the bearer loses Looted Booze.

item.name: Big Brother
item.description: Universal Rule. The models Health Points are set to 8, and its base size is changed to 75x100 mm. The roll for the number of hits from its Stomp Attacks is subject to Maximised Roll.

item.name: Giant Club
item.description: Close Combat Weapon. Attacks made with this weapon gain +1 Strength and +1 Armour Penetration.

item.name: Uprooted Tree
item.description: Close Combat Weapon. Attacks made with this weapon hit automatically and have their Strength set to 5 and their Armour Penetration set to 0.
